articles.headline: Uplink update: Computers and Campaigns
articles.summary: This article discusses the role of computers in modernizing election coverage and reporting, including the use of digital campaign contribution data and the Internet for real-time election results.

articles.headline: Finding the best politicians money can buy
articles.summary: The article explores the influence of campaign finance data on political narratives and candidate profiles, highlighting the importance of money in politics.

articles.headline: Pulitzer winner calculates justice
articles.summary: Melvin Claxton's Pulitzer-winning investigation into the failures of the Virgin Islands criminal justice system demonstrates the power of computer-assisted reporting.

articles.headline: Building your own database
articles.summary: This article provides tips for journalists on constructing databases from hard-copy documents to aid in reporting, with insights on data entry options.

articles.headline: Linking money before the vote
articles.summary: Reporters successfully pressured candidates to disclose campaign contributions before legal deadlines, providing voters with early insights into political financing.

articles.headline: On the World Wide: Web
articles.summary: Syracuse Newspapers utilized the Internet and audiotext services to report live election results, demonstrating advanced newsroom technologies in real-time reporting.

articles.headline: On the Internet: Campaign coverage
articles.summary: A guide to using the Internet for campaign coverage, highlighting key websites and resources for issue backgrounds, voting records, and financial disclosures.
